{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cardiolipin is indeed found in the inner mitochondrial membrane as stated in Document [1]. It also plays a role in the process of apoptosis as mentioned in Document [7]. Document [5] confirms that cardiolipin is a type of diphosphatidyl glycerol. However, there is no mention in any of the documents about cardiolipin having a choline base with a labile methyl group.", "answer_choice": "D"}
